$comment: Missio-specific schema extensions. Merged into opencollectionschema-source.json at build time to produce opencollectionschema.json. Each entry describes a JSON Schema patch: where to inject properties and what $defs to add.

justifications.reason: The OpenCollection spec has no concept of external secret resolution. Missio integrates with Azure Key Vault (and potentially other providers) to resolve secret variable references at runtime, keeping sensitive values out of YAML files entirely.

The spec's auth inheritance chain (request → folder → collection) doesn't provide a way to enforce collection-level auth globally. Enterprise collections often need a single OAuth2 config applied uniformly, without risk of individual requests overriding it.

The spec's OAuth2 token storage is keyed by access token URL, but real-world scenarios require multiple credential sets against the same identity provider (e.g. different client IDs for different tenants). credentialsId disambiguates token storage keys.

SecretProvider.description: A secret provider for resolving secret variables at runtime

name.description: The name of the secret provider

namespace.description: The namespace identifier (e.g. vault name for Azure Key Vault), supports {{var}} interpolation

subscription.description: Azure subscription ID or name (for cross-subscription vaults)

disabled.description: Whether the secret provider is disabled

secretProviders.description: Array of secret providers for resolving secret variables

patches.description: Add forceAuthInherit to CollectionConfig for overriding auth inheritance

forceAuthInherit.description: When true, all requests in this collection use the collection-level auth, ignoring request and folder auth settings

credentialsId.description: Identifier for distinguishing multiple credential sets for the same token URL
